sentence.Network_en: The report concludes that I acted neither fraudulently nor improperly.
sentence.Network_cn: 报告最后认为我的行为既没有欺骗性也没有任何不妥。

sentence.Network_en: They can neither read nor write, nor can they comprehend such concepts.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们不会读，不会写，也理解不了这样的概念。

sentence.Network_en: That, if you'll pardon my saying so, is neither here nor there.
sentence.Network_cn: 恕我直言，那根本就不重要。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 无关紧要的或不相干的

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: alteration (by association with either) of Old English nawther, contraction of nāhwæther (from nā 'no' + hwæther 'whether')

entry.def: You use neither in front of the first of two or more words or expressions when you are linking two or more things which are not true or do not happen. The other thing is introduced by 'nor'.

example.ex: Professor Hisamatsu spoke neither English nor German...
example.tran: 久松教授既不会讲英语，也不会讲德语。

example.ex: The play is neither as funny nor as disturbing as Tabori thinks it is.
example.tran: 这部戏既不像塔博里想象的那么滑稽，也不像他想象的那么让人讨厌。

entry.tran: 两个都不;(两者之中)无一个
entry.def: You use neither to refer to each of two things or people, when you are making a negative statement that includes both of them.

example.ex: At first, neither man could speak.

entry.def: If you say that one person or thing does not do something and neither does another, what you say is true of all the people or things that you are mentioning.

example.ex: I never learned to swim and neither did they...
example.tran: 我从没学过游泳，他们也没有。

example.ex: Britain does not agree and neither do Denmark, Portugal and Ireland.
example.tran: 英国不同意，丹麦、葡萄牙和爱尔兰也持反对意见。

entry.tran: (用于否定陈述后，强调要引出另一否定陈述)也不
entry.def: You use neither after a negative statement to emphasize that you are introducing another negative statement.

example.ex: I can't ever recall Dad hugging me. Neither did I sit on his knee.
example.tran: 我不记得爸爸曾经抱过我，我也没在他膝盖上坐过。

entry.def: If you say that something is neither here nor there, you mean that it does not matter because it is not a relevant point.

example.ex: 'I'd never heard of her before I came here.' — 'That is neither here nor there.'
example.tran: “来之前我从未听说过她。”——“那没什么。”

example.ex: Whether or not he realised the fact was neither here nor there.
example.tran: 他是否认识到事实真相无关紧要。

means.word_mean: 1. after a negative statement used to indicate that the next statement is similarly negative;

sentences.sentence: "I was not happy and neither were they"
"just as you would not complain, neither should he"

auth_sentence.content: Of course, neither perception is anything but delusory.
auth_sentence.res_content: Of course, neither perception is anything but delusory.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Of course, neither perception is anything but delusory.

auth_sentence.content: Neither of them asks more than I can do.
auth_sentence.res_content: Neither of them asks more than I can do.

auth_sentence.content: The good news is that neither outcome has occurred.
auth_sentence.res_content: The good news is that neither outcome has occurred.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 其变体n用在元音前面,表示"不,非"

stems_affixes.word_buile: ne不,非+utral→adj.中立的;中性的,中和的
ne不,非+either[两者]任一的→neither[两者]都不
ne不,非+ever曾经, 永远→永远都不→决不
never决不+the+less无……→具有转折之意:没有决不→然而
ne不,非+either[两者]任一的→neither[两者]都不
never决不+the+less无……→具有转折之意:没有决不→然而

Sentence.sentence: They feared neither spouse could manage alone.
Yet neither Barack Obama nor Mitt Romney promotes himself as tool-savvy (使用工具很在行的) presidential timber, in the mold of a Jimmy Carter, a skilled carpenter and cabinet maker.
Neither is applicable to the woman's case.
Assuming that your teacher is neither biased nor corrupt and that her system conforms to school rules, you can't fault her ethics.

sentences.en: I went to see Jack and Bill yesterday, but neither one was at home.
sentences.cn: 昨天我去看杰克和比尔, 可是两个人都不在家。

sentences.en: On neither side of the street are there any trees.
sentences.cn: 街道两旁都没有什么树木。

sentences.en: In neither case can we agree.
sentences.cn: 无论哪一种情况, 我们都不能同意。

sentences.en: I have two hats but neither fits me properly.
sentences.cn: 我有两顶帽子, 但对我都不适合我。

sentences.en: Neither of my parents is a teacher.
Neither of you believes one word that you are saying.
sentences.cn: 你们连自己说的一句话也不相信。

sentences.en: Which of the two films did you like?

means.word_mean: （否定的陈述同样适用其他人或物）也不

sentences.en: You didn't see him, and neither did I.
sentences.cn: 你没有看见他, 我也没有。

sentences.en: If you do not go, neither shall I.
Just as I haven't good eyes, neither have my children.
sentences.cn: 就好像我视力不好, 我的孩子们视力都不好。

sentences.en: The first one was not good, neither was the second one.
sentences.cn: 第一个不好, 第二个也不好。

sentences.en: Neither Jack nor I have seen this film.
sentences.cn: 杰克和我都没有看过这部电影。

sentences.en: Neither volleyball nor basketball is a hundred years old.
sentences.cn: 排球和篮球都不到一百年的历史。

sentences.en: Neither you nor he is right.
Neither the teacher nor his students know how to work out the problem.
sentences.cn: 老师和他的学生们都解不出那道题。

sentences.en: I left my watch on the table, but when I returned I could find neither hide nor hair.
sentences.cn: 我把手表忘在桌上了;  可当我回来找时, 什么都没有了。

sentences.en: This essay hardly makes any sense, it's neither rhyme nor reason.
sentences.cn: 这篇文章写得不伦不类, 简直不知所云。

jushi.english: In neither case can we agree.
jushi.chinese: 无论哪一种情况,我们都不能同意。

jushi.english: I went to see Jack and Bill yesterday, but neither one was at home.
jushi.chinese: 昨天我去看杰克和比尔,可是两个人都不在家。
